alert.note: Alert for East Baton Rouge; Iberville; West Baton Rouge (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued December 01 at 2:48PM CST by NWS New Orleans
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH IN EFFECT FROM 6 PM CST THIS EVENING THROUGH LATE TONIGHT... * WHAT...Flash flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues to be possible. * WHERE...A portion of southeast Louisiana, including the following parishes, East Baton Rouge, Iberville and West Baton Rouge. * WHEN...From 6 PM CST this evening through late tonight. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Another round of showers and thunderstorms are anticipated tonight and some locations could see multiple storms initially before a more well defined line of storms develop allowing it to push east. This is also expected to occur over locations that saw around 2 to more than 5 inches of rain last night and given the primed conditions rain could quickly runoff leading to some areas of flash flooding. In addition rainfall intensity will be high leading which will quickly add up and could lead to water piling up in the more urban areas leading to isolated flash flooding. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be prepared to take action should Flash Flood Warnings be issued.

area.areaDesc: East Baton Rouge; Iberville; West Baton Rouge
